Sentencas: Experiments performed in this work explored how Ni-YSZ cermet anodes infiltrated with 1% Sn or 1% BaO mitigate carbon formation compared to undoped Ni-YSZ anodes in functioning solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: In situ vibrational Raman spectroscopy was used to study the early stages of carbon accumulation on the SOFC anodes at 730 degrees C with methane and under open circuit voltage (OCV) conditions.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: Additionally, carbon removal with different gas phase reforming agents was evaluated.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: The effects of these phenomena-carbon accumulation from methane and carbon removal by reforming agents-on the electrochemical capabilities of a device were monitored with electrochemical impedance and voltammetry measurements.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: Vibrational spectra showed that the undoped and 1% Sn infiltrated anodes were very susceptible to carbon formation from methane while considerably less carbon accumulated on the 1% BaO anodes.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: Electrochemical data, however, implied that carbon accumulated in different regions of the anode and that both Sn and BaO effectively reduced carbon accumulation but also inhibited electrochemical oxidation.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: For each anode, H2O was the most effective reforming agent for removing carbon followed by O-2 and then CO2.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: H2O and CO2, however, left the anode only partially oxidized, while prolonged exposure to O-2 completely oxidized Ni to nickel oxide.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane

Sentencas: The spectroscopic and electrochemical data showed strong correlations that provide mechanistic insight into the consequences of adding secondary materials to SOFC anodes with the intent of reducing carbon accumulation.
Titulo: Comparing in Situ Carbon Tolerances of Sn-Infiltrated and BaO-Infiltrated Ni-YSZ Cermet Anodes in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Exposed to Methane
